intro: Tounatea brachystachya, commonly known as the short-stalked tounatea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly rough texture. Tounatea brachystachya is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
